attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Zaha Hadid Architects (ZHA) is a world-renowned architectural practice known for its bold, innovative, and iconic designs. Founded by the late Dame Zaha Hadid, the first woman to receive the Pritzker Architecture Prize, ZHA continues to push the boundaries of architecture, embracing fluid forms, dynamic geometries, and cutting-edge technologies to create buildings that inspire and transform spaces.

body.value:
Zaha Hadid Architects (ZHA) is a world-renowned architectural practice known for its bold, innovative, and iconic designs. Founded by the late Dame Zaha Hadid, the first woman to receive the Pritzker Architecture Prize, ZHA continues to push the boundaries of architecture, embracing fluid forms, dynamic geometries, and cutting-edge technologies to create buildings that inspire and transform spaces.

Based in London, ZHA operates globally, delivering a wide range of projects that span cultural, residential, commercial, and civic sectors. The firm's work is characterized by a commitment to integrating architecture with its surroundings, using advanced computational design techniques to achieve sustainability and efficiency.

attributes.content: The Angola Sovereign Fund, abbreviated as Fund or FSDEA, is a collective public institution with legal personality and administrative, financial and patrimonial autonomy, created under Presidential Decree No. 48/11, of 9 March.

body.value:
The Angola Sovereign Fund, abbreviated as Fund or FSDEA, is a collective public institution with legal personality and administrative, financial and patrimonial autonomy, created under Presidential Decree No. 48/11, of 9 March.

The FSDEA is an institution specialized in strategic investments, whether in financial markets or in alternative assets, which is responsible for setting up a sustainable mechanism that ensures the maximization of long-term returns, the preservation of capital and support for Angola's sustainable socio-economic growth, through investments in strategic sectors, in Angola or abroad, with a view to maximizing capital and the generational transfer of wealth.

 

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.content: Specialised ConsultingMCC provides specialised consulting services to its mining and infrastructure clients in a number of specialised fields such as executive management, mine development, operations optimisation and improvements, mine ownership and public and private fundraising in addition to its portfolio of project management and engineering services. The profile and extent of specialist services provided is tailored to suit the client’s business or project requirements.

body.value:
Specialised Consulting
MCC provides specialised consulting services to its mining and infrastructure clients in a number of specialised fields such as executive management, mine development, operations optimisation and improvements, mine ownership and public and private fundraising in addition to its portfolio of project management and engineering services. The profile and extent of specialist services provided is tailored to suit the client’s business or project requirements.

Consulting Modules Portfolio
MCC offers a portfolio of consulting modules that are geared to focus on significantly improving the client’s bottom line through strategic and tactical interventions. The company has provided professional services that have contributed significant value to a large number of ventures undertaken by its clients across a broad spectrum of countries and commodities.

Extensive Experience
Within MCC there is experience extending across all aspects of the mining spectrum including operational, executive management, and capital project execution. Specifically there is considerable experience in the design, construction and management of large capital projects. MCC ensures that particular attention is given to the quality of project front-end loading and thus to the creation of cost-effective and ideally fit-for-purpose world-class business focused solutions.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: The European Union (EU) is a union of 27 European countries designed to promote economic cooperation, peace, and stability. Originating from the post-World War II European Coal and Steel Community (1951) and the European Economic Community (1957), it was formally established by the Maastricht Treaty in 1992, which also introduced the euro. Key institutions include the European Commission, European Parliament, and European Court of Justice. The EU aims to facilitate a single market with free movement of goods, services, capital, and people, while advocating for human rights and democracy.

body.value: The European Union (EU) is a union of 27 European countries designed to promote economic cooperation, peace, and stability. Originating from the post-World War II European Coal and Steel Community (1951) and the European Economic Community (1957), it was formally established by the Maastricht Treaty in 1992, which also introduced the euro. Key institutions include the European Commission, European Parliament, and European Court of Justice. The EU aims to facilitate a single market with free movement of goods, services, capital, and people, while advocating for human rights and democracy. With 20 of its member states using the euro, the EU has expanded from six to 27 members and plays a significant role in global trade, development, and climate issues.

attributes.content: The Water Utilities Corporation (WUC) is a parastatal organization wholly owned by the Botswana Government. Established in 1970 by an Act of Parliament, WUC was initially mandated to manage a single project for the supply and distribution of water in what was then called the Shashe Development Area. This mandate has since expanded to include the planning, construction, operation, treatment, maintenance, and distribution of water resources in the country’s urban centers and other areas as directed by the Botswana Government.

body.value: The Water Utilities Corporation (WUC) is a parastatal organization wholly owned by the Botswana Government. Established in 1970 by an Act of Parliament, WUC was initially mandated to manage a single project for the supply and distribution of water in what was then called the Shashe Development Area. This mandate has since expanded to include the planning, construction, operation, treatment, maintenance, and distribution of water resources in the country’s urban centers and other areas as directed by the Botswana Government. Additionally, WUC is responsible for supplying bulk water to the Department of Water Affairs and various local authorities for distribution to villages and settlements across the country.

attributes.content: The Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC), established by the U.S. in 2004, is a foreign aid agency focused on reducing global poverty through targeted development assistance. Its unique approach involves partnering with countries committed to reforms in governance, economic freedom, and anti-corruption.

body.value: The Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC), established by the U.S. in 2004, is a foreign aid agency focused on reducing global poverty through targeted development assistance. Its unique approach involves partnering with countries committed to reforms in governance, economic freedom, and anti-corruption. Key aspects of the MCC’s strategy include allocating aid based on performance indicators related to these reforms, providing significant investments through large-scale compacts with eligible nations, and supporting near-eligible countries with Threshold Programs to help them meet eligibility criteria. The MCC emphasizes recipient country ownership in project design and implementation to ensure local alignment, and it prioritizes measurable outcomes and rigorous evaluation for effective poverty reduction. Additionally, the MCC collaborates with international organizations, local governments, and the private sector to leverage resources and expertise, aiming to promote sustainable development and economic growth in reform-minded countries.

attributes.content: Umgeni Water, now part of uMngeni-uThukela Water, is a prominent state-owned entity in South Africa, primarily focused on providing bulk potable water and sanitation services in KwaZulu-Natal. body.value:
Umgeni Water, now part of uMngeni-uThukela Water, is a prominent state-owned entity in South Africa, primarily focused on providing bulk potable water and sanitation services in KwaZulu-Natal. Established in 1974, the organization has grown to be one of the most successful in water management on the continent.

The organization operates under the mandate of the Water Services Act and the Public Finance Management Act, reporting directly to the Department of Water and Sanitation. uMngeni-uThukela Water's activities include not only the supply of water services but also management services, training, catchment management, and water conservation functions. The entity ensures efficient delivery and implementation of infrastructure projects while adhering to environmental and social engagement standards.

Invictus aims to build a portfolio of high-potential conventional oil and gas assets that deliver significant benefits to shareholders while fostering regional development. The company's strategy involves targeting under-explored or emerging play types ahead of larger industry players, adding value through technical expertise, regional experience, and strategic partnerships.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Environmental Management Agency (EMA) is a statutory body in Zimbabwe under the Ministry of Environment, Water, and Climate. Established under the Environmental Management Act, and operational since March, 2003, EMA is responsible for ensuring the sustainable utilization of natural resources and environmental protection. Its mission includes regulating, monitoring, and promoting sustainable environmental management with stakeholder participation.

body.value:
The Environmental Management Agency (EMA) is a statutory body in Zimbabwe under the Ministry of Environment, Water, and Climate. Established under the Environmental Management Act, and operational since March, 2003, EMA is responsible for ensuring the sustainable utilization of natural resources and environmental protection. Its mission includes regulating, monitoring, and promoting sustainable environmental management with stakeholder participation. 

EMA operates through two main departments: Environmental Protection, which offers environmental protection and laboratory analytical services, and Environmental Management Services, which provides environmental research, planning, monitoring, education, and information dissemination.

attributes.content: The International Solar Alliance (ISA) is a joint initiative between India and France, designed to tackle climate change through the promotion of solar energy solutions. The alliance was conceptualized during COP21 in Paris in 2015. Following an amendment to its Framework Agreement in 2020, all UN member states became eligible to join the ISA. Currently, over 100 countries are signatories, with more than 90 having ratified to become full members. The ISA aims to unlock $1 trillion in solar investments by 2030 while driving down technology and financing costs.

The alliance was conceptualized during COP21 in Paris in 2015. Following an amendment to its Framework Agreement in 2020, all UN member states became eligible to join the ISA. 

Currently, over 100 countries are signatories, with more than 90 having ratified to become full members. The ISA aims to unlock $1 trillion in solar investments by 2030 while driving down technology and financing costs.

body.value:
GTR (Les Grands Travaux Routiers) is a leading Moroccan construction company specializing in road and infrastructure development. As a subsidiary of the French group Colas, GTR leverages international expertise and advanced engineering techniques to deliver high-quality civil engineering solutions across Morocco.

GTR plays a pivotal role in Morocco's infrastructure growth, including its involvement in the Kenitra-Marrakech High-Speed Line, where it is responsible for civil engineering works, earthworks, and bridge construction. Their technical proficiency and strategic execution contribute significantly to enhancing transportation networks and supporting the nation’s economic development.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: ACCIONA is a global group that develops and manages sustainable infrastructure solutions, particularly in renewable energy. The company operates across the entire value chain, from design and construction to operation and maintenance.

body.value:
ACCIONA is a global group that develops and manages sustainable infrastructure solutions, particularly in renewable energy. The company operates across the entire value chain, from design and construction to operation and maintenance.

ACCIONA’s goal is to lead the transition to a low-carbon economy, bringing technical excellence and innovation to all its projects to help design a better planet. With a presence in over 40 countries and €17.02 billion in sales in 2023, the company is dedicated to contributing to the economic and social development of the communities where it operates. With nearly a century of experience, ACCIONA is better equipped than ever to face the challenges confronting our planet and continue leading the way toward a more sustainable future.

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Transnet National Ports Authority (TNPA) is a division of Transnet SOC Ltd, responsible for managing and regulating South Africa's commercial ports system. TNPA oversees the operation, maintenance, and development of eight major ports, including Durban, Cape Town, and Richards Bay, ensuring safe, efficient, and sustainable maritime trade. It plays a crucial role in supporting South Africa's economy by facilitating international trade and driving port infrastructure development to enhance global competitiveness.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Zululand Energy Terminal is a joint venture between Vopak Terminal Durban and Transnet Pipelines (TPL), established to develop and operate a state-of-the-art LNG import terminal at the Port of Richards Bay, South Africa.

body.value:
Zululand Energy Terminal is a joint venture between Vopak Terminal Durban and Transnet Pipelines (TPL), established to develop and operate a state-of-the-art LNG import terminal at the Port of Richards Bay, South Africa. 

Designed to enhance the country’s energy security and support industrial growth, the terminal will be developed in two phases, starting with a Floating Storage Unit (FSU) and onshore regasification infrastructure, followed by the construction of an onshore storage tank. This strategic project is set to play a pivotal role in South Africa's energy transition by providing reliable and sustainable gas solutions.
body.processed:
Zululand Energy Terminal is a joint venture between Vopak Terminal Durban and Transnet Pipelines (TPL), established to develop and operate a state-of-the-art LNG import terminal at the Port of Richards Bay, South Africa. 

Designed to enhance the country’s energy security and support industrial growth, the terminal will be developed in two phases, starting with a Floating Storage Unit (FSU) and onshore regasification infrastructure, followed by the construction of an onshore storage tank. This strategic project is set to play a pivotal role in South Africa's energy transition by providing reliable and sustainable gas solutions.

The firm's focus on innovation and professionalism supports regional development and economic growth in Zimbabwe and neighboring countries.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Platinum Group Metals (PGMs) are essential and precious metals which include platinum, palladium, rhodium, iridium, osmium, and ruthenium. These metals are known for their purity, high melting points and unique catalytic properties. In addition to their oxidation and reduction properties, they are also extremely resistant to corrosion. PGMs are utilized in a number of industrial processes, technologies and commercial applications. Their unique chemical and physical properties make PGMs an excellent raw material, catalyst and ingredient for manufacturing processes.

body.value: Platinum Group Metals (PGMs) are essential and precious metals which include platinum, palladium, rhodium, iridium, osmium, and ruthenium. These metals are known for their purity, high melting points and unique catalytic properties. In addition to their oxidation and reduction properties, they are also extremely resistant to corrosion. PGMs are utilized in a number of industrial processes, technologies and commercial applications. Their unique chemical and physical properties make PGMs an excellent raw material, catalyst and ingredient for manufacturing processes. Consumer and industrial products made with platinum and other PGMs include flat panel monitors, glass fibre, medical tools, computer hard drives, nylon and razors, among others. PGMs play a critical role in autocatalysis and pollution control in the automotive sector. The bulk of global PGMs are mined in Southern Africa and Russia.
